text: The arrondissement of Millau is an arrondissement of France. It is part of the Aveyron département in the Occitanie region. Its capital, and subprefecture of the department, is the city of Millau. ==History== When the arrondissements were created in 1800, Millau was one of them in the Aveyron department. ==Geography== It is the southeastern part of the arrondissements of the department, with an area of , the second in area of the department, and a population of 70,995 inhabitants and a population density of inhabitants/km². The arrondissement is bordered to the north and west by the arrondissement of Rodez, to the northeast by the Lozère department, to the east by the Gard department, to the south by the Hérault department and to the southwest by the Tarn department. ==Composition== ===Cantons=== After the reorganisation of the cantons in France, cantons are not subdivisions of the arrondissements so they could have communes that belong to different arrondissements. In the arrondissement of Millau, there is only one canton where not all their "communes" are in the arrondissement: Raspes et Lévezou.
